parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fever, scorching heat. From puresso; inflamed, i.e. feverish.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
